column3: Consumption of general government fixed capital \2\

column2: NA
1. Government consumption expenditures are services (such as education and national defense) produced by government that
are valued at their cost of production. Excludes government sales to other sectors and government own-account investment
(construction and software).
2. Consumption of fixed capital, or depreciation, is included in government gross output as
a partial measure of the services of general government fixed assets; the use of depreciation
assumes a zero net return on these assets.
3. Includes general government intermediate inputs for goods and services sold to other sectors and
for own-account investment.
4. Own-account investment is measured in current dollars by compensation of general government
employees and related expenditures for goods and services and is classified as investment in
structures and in software in table 3.9.5.
